title: Pan-Seared Thick-Cut Boneless Pork Chops
subtitle: Deeply seared outside, juicy and tender inside
description: This technique uses a blazing-hot cast-iron pan and careful flipping to create the perfect pork chop.
author: Andrew Janjigian
instructions: Adjust oven rack to middle position, place 12-inch cast-iron skillet on rack, and heat oven to 500°F. Meanwhile, cut roast crosswise into 4 chops of equal thickness.

When oven reaches 500°F, pat chops dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Using potholders, remove skillet from oven and place over high heat. Add oil and heat until just smoking. Add chops and cook without moving until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.
Flip chops and cook until lightly browned on second side, about 2 minutes.
Continue flipping every 2 minutes, adjusting heat as needed, until chops are well browned and internal temperature reaches 125–130°F, about 10–12 minutes longer.
Transfer chops to a platter, tent with foil, and let rest for 15 minutes (temperature will rise to 140°F). Serve.
notes: Natural pork (not enhanced) is strongly preferred for better browning and flavor. Serve with Roasted Red Pepper-Vinegar Sauce if desired.
